snippet: A lawsuit against the Ferguson-Florissant School District board argues that at-large voting discriminates against minorities.
abstract: American Civil Liberties Union lawsuit claims use of at-large voting by Missouri's Ferguson-Florissant School District discriminates against minority voters; proposes instead creation of subdistricts, which would have school board candidates running for seats in areas where they also reside; under current system, three of four students in district are black, but there have never been more than two black members on seven-person school board at same time.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit against the Ferguson-Florissant School District board argues that at-large voting discriminates against minorities.

headline.main: Board for Ferguson Schools Is Accused of Racial Bias
headline.print_headline: Board for Ferguson Schools Is Accused of Bias in Selecting Members
